title: When it's okay to be an asshole
body:
When it's a custom game: NO
When it's a bot game: NO
When it's a special event: NO
When it's Normals: NO
When it's ranked: NO
When it's Dominion: NO
When it's ARAM: NO
When it's Twisted Treeline: NO
When you're in a premade group: NO
When you're Bronze V: NO
When you're Diamond I: NO
When you're in LCS: NO
When you're a higher rank than your peers: NO
When someone is also being an asshole: NO
When you're "advising" your support: NO
When you're "advising" your jungler: NO
When you're top lane: NO
When you are the jungler: NO
When you are mid: NO
When you are the ADC: NO
When you are the support: NO... as hard as it can be at times.
When you're asking for help: NO
When there's a language barrier: NO
When you're winning: NO
When you're losing: NO
When your surrender vote failed for the second or third time: NO
When another player is playing a "trash tier" champion: NO

I hope this clears some of the confusion out there.

When someone is trolling: YES
Because fighting cancer with cancer works so well.

You're right: it is a poor comparison, because that toxic stuff they're fighting cancer with is much more helpful.
Have you ever played a sport?

When either team has a {{champion:92}} .
If you have picked {{champion:23}} .
When someone is trolling.
When you have an afk.  
When you have a rager.
When you ARE a rager.

Welcome to league... where the only people who aren't jerks are the ones who muted everyone at the start of the game.  :-P

Man, that last statement is super true. I try to be super friendly to people or keep my mouth shut entirely. Eventually found that this was made so much easier by just muting everyone. So, nowadays, if I make a bad play, if someone on either team starts getting mouthy, if anything even remotely triggers that Spidey-sense, I mute everyone in the match and communicate solely on pings. It works absolute wonders. It became so, so, so much easier to recover from bad plays when you don't have an entire team (or two) jumping down your throat about it.
